bytebase.v1.BoundingBox.jsonschema.stric.description: BoundingBox defines the spatial bounds for GEOMETRY spatial indexes.
bytebase.v1.BoundingBox.jsonschema.stric.title: Bounding Box

bytebase.v1.CheckConstraintMetadata.json.description: CheckConstraintMetadata is the metadata for check constraints.

expression.description: The expression is the expression of a check constraint.

name.description: The name is the name of a check constraint.

bytebase.v1.CheckConstraintMetadata.json.title: Check Constraint Metadata

bytebase.v1.DimensionConstraint.jsonsche.description: DimensionConstraint defines constraints for a spatial dimension.

dimension.description: Dimension name/type (X, Y, Z, M, etc.)

bytebase.v1.DimensionConstraint.jsonsche.title: Dimension Constraint

bytebase.v1.DimensionalConfig.jsonschema.description: DimensionalConfig defines dimensional and constraint parameters for spatial indexes.

dataType.description: Spatial data type (GEOMETRY, GEOGRAPHY, POINT, POLYGON, etc.)

bytebase.v1.DimensionalConfig.jsonschema.title: Dimensional Config

bytebase.v1.GridLevel.jsonschema.strict..description: GridLevel defines a tessellation grid level with its density.

level.description: Grid level number (1-4 for SQL Server)

bytebase.v1.GridLevel.jsonschema.strict..title: Grid Level

bytebase.v1.IndexMetadata.jsonschema.str.description: IndexMetadata is the metadata for indexes.

comment.description: The comment is the comment of an index.

descending.description: The descending is the ordered descending of an index.

expressions.description:
The expressions are the ordered columns or expressions of an index.
 This could refer to a column or an expression.

granularity.description: The number of granules in the block. It's a ClickHouse specific field.

isConstraint.description:
It's a PostgreSQL specific field.
 The unique constraint and unique index are not the same thing in PostgreSQL.

keyLength.description:
The key_lengths are the ordered key lengths of an index.
 If the key length is not specified, it's -1.

name.description: The name is the name of an index.

opclassDefaults.description: True if the operator class is the default. (PostgreSQL specific).

opclassNames.description:
https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/catalog-pg-opclass.html
 Name of the operator class for each column. (PostgreSQL specific).

parentIndexName.description: The index name of the parent index.

parentIndexSchema.description: The schema name of the parent index.

primary.description: The primary is whether the index is a primary key index.

spatialConfig.description: Spatial index configuration for spatial databases like SQL Server, PostgreSQL with PostGIS, etc.

type.description: The type is the type of an index.

unique.description: The unique is whether the index is unique.

visible.description: The visible is whether the index is visible.

bytebase.v1.IndexMetadata.jsonschema.str.title: Index Metadata

bytebase.v1.SpatialIndexConfig.jsonschem.description: SpatialIndexConfig defines the spatial index configuration for spatial databases.

tessellation.description: Tessellation configuration for grid-based spatial indexes

bytebase.v1.SpatialIndexConfig.jsonschem.title: Spatial Index Config

bytebase.v1.StorageConfig.jsonschema.str.description: StorageConfig defines storage and performance parameters for spatial indexes.

buffering.description: Buffering mode for PostgreSQL (auto, on, off)

bytebase.v1.StorageConfig.jsonschema.str.title: Storage Config

bytebase.v1.TablePartitionMetadata.jsons.description: TablePartitionMetadata is the metadata for table partitions.

expression.description:
The expression is the expression of a table partition.
 For PostgreSQL, the expression is the text of {FOR VALUES
 partition_bound_spec}, see
 https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/sql-createtable.html. For MySQL,
 the expression is the `expr` or `column_list` of the following syntax.
 PARTITION BY
    { [LINEAR] HASH(expr)
    | [LINEAR] KEY [ALGORITHM={1 | 2}] (column_list)
    | RANGE{(expr) | COLUMNS(column_list)}
    | LIST{(expr) | COLUMNS(column_list)} }.

name.description: The name is the name of a table partition.

subpartitions.description: The subpartitions is the list of subpartitions in a table partition.

type.description: The type of a table partition.
type.title: Type

useDefault.description:
The use_default is whether the users use the default partition, it stores
 the different value for different database engines. For MySQL, it's [INT]
 type, 0 means not use default partition, otherwise, it's equals to number
 in syntax [SUB]PARTITION {number}.

value.description:
The value is the value of a table partition.
 For MySQL, the value is for RANGE and LIST partition types,
 - For a RANGE partition, it contains the value set in the partition's
 VALUES LESS THAN clause, which can be either an integer or MAXVALUE.
 - For a LIST partition, this column contains the values defined in the
 partition's VALUES IN clause, which is a list of comma-separated integer
 values.
 - For others, it's an empty string.

bytebase.v1.TablePartitionMetadata.jsons.title: Table Partition Metadata

bytebase.v1.TessellationConfig.jsonschem.description: TessellationConfig defines tessellation parameters for spatial indexes.

boundingBox.description: Bounding box for GEOMETRY tessellation (not used for GEOGRAPHY)

cellsPerObject.description: Number of cells per object (1-8192 for SQL Server)

gridLevels.description: Grid levels and densities for multi-level tessellation

bytebase.v1.TessellationConfig.jsonschem.title: Tessellation Config
